label: 藤原定家
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Fujiwara no Teika (J.) 藤原定家, also pronounced Sadaie. This aristocrat who rose to the position of deputy middle counsellor was the son of the poet and poetic theorist 俊成 Shunzei (also pronounced Toshinari; 1114-1204), and was known not only as a prominent poet but also as compiler of imperially-sponsored collections such as 新古今和歌集 Shin kokin wakashū He also known for his lengthy diary Meigetsuki, which he continued until his death at 79 in 1241.
